reviewText:
IF YOU HAVE A INTEL HD GRAPHICS CARD ON WINDOWS 7 64BIT. THIS GAME WILL NOT WORK UNDER THE NEWEST PATCH. (1.18). THIS BUG WILL NOT BE FIXED. THE GAME WILL NOT BE UPDATED.

IN ORDER TO GET IT TO WORK WITHOUT BUYING A COMPLETLY NEW VIDEO CARD,
1) RENAME ARMA.EXE TO ARMAOLD.EXE
2) SEARCH AROUND FOR A ARMA.EXE THAT IS FROM VERSION1.14 OR EARLIER, PREFERIBLY V1.14
2b) personally i use  this download [www.mediafire.com] as the file contains a .PNG file showing a email from the publisher proving that it is a legally aquired download to fix a known bug. any other source i can not garuntee the legality of. but the legality of this download is clearly visible in the download file
3) MOVE THE NEW ARMA.EXE TO YOUR GAME INSTALL FOLDER.
4) THEN, IN THE DOWNLOAD SETTINGS , SET THE GAME TO ****NOT**** AUTO UPDATE.
5) enjoy.

MULTIPLAYER DOES NOT WORK WITH THIS FIX. THE ONLY WAY TO GET MULTIPLAYER TO WORK IS TO GET A NEW VIDEO CARD SINCE VERSION 1.18 DOES NOT PLAY WELL WITH INTEL HD GRAPHICS. NIVIDIA IS RECOMENDED.

reviewText: As a gamer who owns all ARMA series, I really want to say, from a retrospective perspective, the game is improving over years but not quite. The graphics and physics certainly become better in latter ARMA2 updates and in ARMA3: vehicles respond to rugged terrains, ragdoll systems etc. Yet that is the only thing I feel realistic" about this game. Other elements are not at all close to real. The map is huge but monotonous(I guess because it's largely computer generated); the way objects interact is ultimately awkward(they still struggle with it in ARMA3); close-up scenario looks beautiful but depth field is very ♥♥♥♥♥♥. These ruthlessly dim the only few other highlights of ARMA."

reviewText:
There isn't much to say, it's a good tactical shooter. The missions are fun and it's full of drivable vehicles. Commanding a squad of soldiers is a little tedious because of the clunky command system but you get used to it. Other than that, I rather enjoyed my time in this game. There isn't anything particularly bad about it, the missions were challenging and I died a lot but I did manage to get by eventually. The campaign is non-linear, it gives you simple choices between differing fronts of engagement and those choices have benefits and consequences. I recommend it to anyone who fancies tactical shooters.

Pros:Challenging missions
Full squad commands
Many drivable vehicles (air, ground, sea)
Non-linear campaign
Large open maps with fairly detailed environments
Interesting tactical firefightsCons:Some distant sounds will sound like they're near you.
Large scale engagements will sometimes resolve themselves before you even get there to take part. I often got lost and had to take detours through hills and towns just to get to the engagement point and by the time I got there, the battle was already won or lost. You need to be quick when you get your objective.
Objectives are not always clear. Might require some exploring, trial and error.Neutral:Menus/UI feel touchy and don't always respond to the first click
No music (for me it isn't a con because I usually turn game music off anyway)
AI is sporadic at best. It will either spot you from 800m away and snipe you or it will walk in random directions 100m off until you shoot at it. But once you do get it's attention, it seems to do alright in a fight.
Overall, I liked this game, it was fun.
voteText: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Arma is the true sequel to Operation Flashpoint and, seven years after its release, I still rate it as one of my all time favourite PC games. The gameplay feels a little clunky compared to subsequent Arma titles but for an old game Arma offers an impressive freedom of movement and immersion. It also has a relatively easy mission editor and I've spent many hours playing Arma online.

reviewText:
Really fun gameplay. I love the campaign and the multiplayer (singleplayer) warfare. I've got an Intel processor that this game doesn't work well with, so if you want to play this game, try to find a cracked version of arma.exe on the internet for version 1.14. Version 1.18 doesn't work with Intel graphics.

This game can be really fun. Some people say it's not too good because of the graphics, but does that really matter? The graphics are fine to me, and the gameplay is awesome! Especially since you can play in 3D. That's what you usually don't see in most FPS games.

If you're used to games like COD, I don't recommend having the float option on at all; it will make you move around your gun before turning. Since COD doesn't do this, it's a bit harder to get used to if you're used to games like COD. Also; Don't ever expect under-a-second kills. It's not a couple shots with a pistol or half a second of shooting to take down an enemy; even in multiplayer!

So, overall, it's a very great game, but can take awhile to get used to for COD fans.
Rating: 957/1000
